## Q1: How do stock prices change over time, looking at the basic information like open, close, high, low etc.**


### EDA
``` {python}
# Step 1: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
df = stocks.copy()

# Convert the date column to datetime format
df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date'])

# Summary Statistics
company_stats = df.groupby('stock_symbol').agg({'open': ['mean', 'median', 'min', 'max', 'std'], 'volume': ['mean', 'median', 'min', 'max', 'std']})
print("Summary Statistics:")
print(company_stats)






```

### Data Visualization 


Closing Prices Over Time for Different Companies
``` {python}
# Company-wise Visualizations
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
for company, data in df.groupby('stock_symbol'):
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['close'], label=company)
plt.title('Closing Prices Over Time for Different Companies')
plt.xlabel('Date')
plt.ylabel('Close Price')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```



Volume Analysis using Bar Plot
``` {python}
# Volume Analysis
avg_volume = df.groupby('stock_symbol')['volume'].mean().sort_values()

# Plotting
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
avg_volume.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Average Volume Traded for Each Stock Symbol')
plt.xlabel('Stock Symbol')
plt.ylabel('Average Volume (Shares Traded)')  # Unit added
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

```
